bibl.title: Further Notes on P. Gr. Wess. Prag. I 13 (= 87).
bibl.note: P. Prag. I, 87. What could the books of lines 3 and 8 have been, The Chronographeion and The Book of Gnosis of Things Leading to the Holy Resurrection? And where in Egypt could a monastic community have been located where such things were read?
bibl.seg: MacCoull Leslie S.B., Further Notes on P. Gr. Wess. Prag. I 13 (= 87).

P. Prag. I, 87. What could the books of lines 3 and 8 have been, The Chronographeion and The Book of Gnosis of Things Leading to the Holy Resurrection? And where in Egypt could a monastic community have been located where such things were read?
